title: Jeep Plans Line of Fully Electric SUVs
sub_head: Global auto maker plans to double revenue by 2030, sustain double-digit operating margins, CEO says
body:
Jeep, a historic American brand that has long been known for its rugged sport-utility vehicles, plans to offer a line of fully electric SUVs in the coming years, as part of a broader strategic road map unveiled Tuesday by parent company Stellantis NV.
The brand will get its first all-electric model in the first half of next year, and by 2025, Jeep will offer a comprehensive line of battery-powered SUVs, covering a range of sizes and price points, said Stellantis Chief Executive Carlos Tavares during a presentation in Amsterdam.
